topic: How to design REST APIs using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to design REST APIs using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Designing REST APIs using FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer provides an overview of creating REST APIs using the FastAPI framework, a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python 3.12 and above.
key_points: FastAPI is based on standard Python type hints to provide automatic documentation generation
It offers automatic support for path parameters, query parameters, headers, cookies, files, and more
Supports OpenAPI 3.0 specification for API description
Includes advanced features such as middleware, custom Request and Response classes, and more.
FastAPI also provides a built-in asynchronous support to improve performance
version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required to use FastAPI
FastAPI version 0.64.0 and later supports Python 3.12
caveats: Make sure you have your development environment set up with the required packages (e.g., FastAPI, Uvicorn, etc.) installed.
FastAPI APIs run on an ASGI server by default (Uvicorn or Hypercorn). It is recommended to use Uvicorn for production.
